Syntax::Utility::Singleton

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Syntax::Utility::Singleton< T >

Singleton base template class.

Derive from this class to create a Singleton class. The template parameter is the name of your derived class. Your derived class must be a friend of this template. Friend classes are bad in general, but could not find another way to make this work. Make sure the constructor is private in your dervived class to insure no one can create an instance of it. You must have a no argument constructor. No other constructors will ever be called.

This template is thread safe.

Example: 

			class MyClass : public Syntax::Utility::Singleton<MyClass>
			{
				friend Syntax::Utility::Singleton<MyClass>;
			public:
				...
				void Test() ...
			private:
				MyClass();
				~MyClass();
			}

			MyClass::Instance()->Test();

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
static T* Syntax::Utility::Singleton< T >::Instance (  )  [inline, static]

Get the one and only instance.

Returns the only instance of this Singleton class. Function is thread safe. Always returns the same pointer.
